page.title: 02Farming in the area
page.content: Until the Second World War,this well watered pasture land was used mainly for rearing cattle and sheep.Most farms kept a few dairy cows.Root crops were grown for livestock and only a few acres of cereals were grown.Since the war there have been two fundamental changes,more cereal has been grown and the use of powerful tractors and machines,resulting in less labour. Today the majority of the fields in the area grow wheat or barley.There are a few new crops to break the cereal rotation,such as oil seed rape. There are four dairy farms in the area which grow mainly leys (cultivated grass not permanent pasture) for grazing and silage making.Most farms keep some sheep and beef cattle.A few pigs are kept and bred too.These animals are bought and sold at the market in nearby Banbury.
